findings.title: Market can be resolved at any time after expiry
findings.description: The market can be resolved via the Harbinger oracle callback `market.receive_prices` entry point at any time after `trading_end`, allowing an attacker to delay resolution and wait for a profitable price.

findings.title: FA2.balance_of inconsistent behavior
findings.description: The FA2.balance_of entry point fails with a 'no such token' message if the owner is in the options big_map but does not own any data regarding the given token id. If the owner is currently not even set in the options bigmap, the transaction does not fail and instead declares the balance for the (owner, token_id) as 0.

findings.title: minCapital equality
findings.description: In `market.init` entry point of `binary_option_market.tz`, allowing `total_bids` equal to `min_capital` but checking for strict inequality when admin cancels their bid, causing inconsistency.

findings.title: Error message does not match FA2 specification (insufficient balance)
findings.description: The error message does not conform to the FA2 specification when the transfer amount exceeds the current token balance of the source address. Instead of using 'FA2_INSUFFICIENT_BALANCE', it uses a pattern with 'SUB; ISNAT; ASSERT_SOME' on L61.

findings.title: Error message does not match FA2 specification (undefined token)
findings.description: The error message used when a specified token_id is not defined within the FA2 contract does not match the FA2 specification. Instead of using 'FA2_TOKEN_UNDEFINED', it uses 'no such token'.

findings.title: Error message does not match FA2 specification (not operator)
findings.description: The error message used on L58 is 'not allowed' instead of 'FA2_NOT_OPERATOR' as specified in tzip-12 for transfers where the address that invokes a transfer operation is neither a token owner nor one of the permitted operators.

findings.title: Privileged roles and ownership
findings.description: The option factory contract can change the option contract used by the market contract at will, which could have important consequences for end-users.

findings.title: Option tokens for the losing side will never be burned
findings.description: In `binary_option_market.tz`, option tokens for the losing side will never be burned.

findings.title: Anyone can burn their option tokens
findings.description: In `fa2_with_factory.tz`, anyone can burn their option tokens by sending it to the market contract.
